intro: Caulokaempferia dinabandhuana, commonly known as the Dinabandhuana ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and turmeric. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and aromatic properties. The rhizomes of this plant are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
